uk.org.lidalia.lang

Class Exceptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.org.lidalia.lang.Exceptions

  • public final class Exceptions
extends Object
    Static utility functions around Exception management.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void throwUnchecked(Throwable toThrow) 
      static <T> T throwUnchecked(Throwable toThrow, T returnType)
      Because this method throws an unchecked exception, when it is called in a method with a return type the compiler does not know the method is exiting, requiring a further line to return null or throw an unchecked exception directly.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • throwUnchecked

        public static <T> T throwUnchecked(Throwable toThrow,
                   T returnType)
        Because this method throws an unchecked exception, when it is called in a method with a return type the compiler does not know the method is exiting, requiring a further line to return null or throw an unchecked exception directly. This generified method allows this to be avoided by tricking the compiler by adding a return statement as so: 
             String someMethod() {
         try {
             somethingThatThrowsException();
         } catch (Exception e) {
             return throwUnchecked(e, null); // does not actually return, throws the exception
         }
     }
        Parameters:
        toThrow - The throwable that will be thrown, unwrapped and unchecked; must not be null
        returnType - trick to persuade the compiler that a method returns appropriately - always pass null here
        Returns:
        Never returns, always throws the passed in exception
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if toThrow is null

      • throwUnchecked

        public static void throwUnchecked(Throwable toThrow)
        Parameters:
        toThrow - The throwable that will be thrown, unwrapped and unchecked; must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if toThrow is null
